message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a self-supervised training strategy for speaker embeddings, which involves reconstructing the frames of a target speech segment given the inferred embedding of another speech segment of the same utterance. This approach falls under the category of unsupervised or self-supervised learning, which is typically associated with the sub-categories of cs.SD (Sound) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves the use of neural networks and optimization techniques, which are common in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed approach on speaker recognition datasets, which is relevant to the sub-category of cs.SD.
